meanings.definition: Instruct or urge (someone) to do something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher will enjoin the students to complete their homework on time.
meanings.sent2: I always enjoin my little brother to brush his teeth before bed.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy seemed to enjoin the sleepy cat to play with him.
meanings.sent4: The wise elder would enjoin the young ones to listen to the stories of the past.
meanings.sent5: The coach would enjoin the team to give their best effort in the upcoming match.

meanings.definition: Prohibit or forbid (someone) from doing something.
meanings.sent1: The sign clearly enjoin visitors from entering the construction site.
meanings.sent2: The rules enjoin students from using their phones during exams.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel seemed to enjoin the birds from landing on its favorite tree.
meanings.sent4: The ancient curse seemed to enjoin anyone who dared to enter the forbidden cave.
meanings.sent5: The wizard's spell enjoin anyone from revealing the secret incantation to outsiders.
